Articles.Content:
The second attempt. The first time the rocket apparently thought that the fastest way to orbit was through Kerbin . Still had some fuel to spare but I had to ditch the final stage. That whole Kessler Syndrome thing is just a crock anyway,like Global Warming, right...

UPDATE: Tried to send a crew up...Jeb was getting awful lonely. Unfortunately, disaster struck when the vessel collided with its own stage . The crew survived and was close enough to transfer via EVA but there was only enough room for Bob and Bill, poor ____ (I dont remember his name) "volunteering" to stay in the now parachute-less pod to await rescue.

Half an hour later, I had assembled this:

https://scontent-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xfp1/t1.0-9/10501641_869816569699484_1549387990117998775_n.jpg

In what can only be described as a "holy **** That actually worked" moment, the aptly (though not, I admit, creatively) named Rescuer, grabbed and deorbited our brave kerbal:

https://fbcdn-sphotos-b-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xfp1/t1.0-9/10394822_869817756366032_7010582964884084491_n.jpg

https://scontent-b.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/t1.0-9/10423860_869817763032698_67711170205707921_n.jpg

https://scontent-a.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/t1.0-9/10404063_869817786366029_8806096368914210984_n.jpg

Hopefully I wont have to do that again

Edited June 28, 2014 by Kevon87
